Paragraph

Modifies the format of the current paragraph, such as indents and alignment. To modify the font of the current paragraph, select the entire paragraph, choose Format - Character, and then click on the Font tab.

To access this command...

Choose Format - Paragraph

On Text Formatting bar (with cursor in object), click

Paragraph


The paragraph style for the current paragraph is displayed at the Formatting toolbar, and is highlighted in the Styles window.

Indents and Spacing

Sets the indenting and the spacing options for the paragraph.

Alignment

Sets the alignment of the paragraph relative to the margins of page.

Text Flow

Specify hyphenation and pagination options.

Outline & Numbering

Adds or removes outline level, numbering, or bullets from the paragraph. You can also select the style of numbering to use, and reset the numbering in a numbered list.

Tabs

Set the position of a tab stop in a paragraph.

Drop Caps

Formats the first letter of a paragraph with a large capital letter, that can span several lines. The paragraph must span at least as many lines as you specify in the Lines box.

Asian Typography

Set the typographic options for cells or paragraphs in Asian language files. To enable Asian language support, choose Language Settings - Languages in the Options dialog box, and then select the Enabled box in the Asian language support area. The Asian typography options are ignored in HTML documents.

Asian Typography

Set the typographic options for cells or paragraphs in Asian language files. To enable Asian language support, choose Language Settings - Languages in the Options dialog box, and then select the Enabled box in the Asian language support area. The Asian typography options are ignored in HTML documents.

Borders

Sets the border options for the selected objects in Writer or Calc.

Background

Set the background color or graphic.

Reset

Resets changes made to the current tab to those applicable when this dialog was opened.
